meanings.definition: A small, fast Spanish or Portuguese sailing ship of the 15th-17th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The caravels sailed swiftly across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Explorers relied on caravels to navigate the seas.
meanings.sent3: The caravels raced each other to distant lands.
meanings.sent4: In my dreams, caravels symbolize adventure and discovery.
meanings.sent5: The caravels' sails billowed in the wind, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A type of ship used by explorers during the Age of Discovery.
meanings.sent1: Many caravels set sail in search of new lands.
meanings.sent2: The caravels' crews were fearless in their exploration.
meanings.sent3: The caravels carried brave adventurers on their journeys.
meanings.sent4: The caravels cut through the waves like knives through butter.
meanings.sent5: The caravels' hulls were sturdy, ready to face any challenge.

meanings.definition: A vessel with a high deck and three or four masts.
meanings.sent1: The caravels' masts reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: Sailors climbed the caravels' rigging with ease.
meanings.sent3: The caravels' decks offered a commanding view of the sea.
meanings.sent4: The caravels stood tall and proud in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The caravels' design made them stand out among other ships.
